abstract: The rectangle of the item’s visible content.
overview:
## Discussion

The rectangle in this property corresponds to the onscreen frame rectangle of the item. This rectangle may or may not intersect the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSItemProvider/sourceFrame] rectangle of the item. An intersection of the rectangles means that at least part of the item is visible onscreen.

The rectangle in this property may be a clipped version of the source frame or it might be [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSZeroRect] if the item is offscreen or the system can’t determine the clipping rectangle. The system treats a value of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSZeroRect] as meaning the item is fully visible.

# containerFrame

**Instance Property**

The rectangle of the item’s visible content.

## Declaration

```swift
var containerFrame: NSRect { get }
```

## Discussion

The rectangle in this property corresponds to the onscreen frame rectangle of the item. This rectangle may or may not intersect the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSItemProvider/sourceFrame] rectangle of the item. An intersection of the rectangles means that at least part of the item is visible onscreen.

The rectangle in this property may be a clipped version of the source frame or it might be [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSZeroRect] if the item is offscreen or the system can’t determine the clipping rectangle. The system treats a value of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSZeroRect] as meaning the item is fully visible.

## Getting the provider’s frame

- **sourceFrame**: The rectangle that the item occupies in the host app’s source window.
